website_summaries.verdict: A popular and affordable surface spray that works to discourage chewing.
pros: Can be used directly on dogs or other problem surfaces
cons: May require frequent reapplication for determined or stubborn dogs
Some dogs may get used to the smell and taste

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work for my 6 month old yellow lab
customer_reviews.text: Take a look at the photo. That should pretty much tell you the story. My 6 month old yellow lab likes to eat everything. I bought this spray to keep her from eating things like cat poop, fallen fruit, acorns, etc... This stuff must be a condiment to her, because it doesnt even affect her!! She munches on whatever she pleases, even when doused with this spray.
customer_reviews.author: Sheetrock

customer_reviews.title: ... this spray off of anything I sprayed it on like she really enjoyed it
customer_reviews.text: My dog was licking this spray off of anything I sprayed it on like she really enjoyed it. I took her to puppy training classes at Petsmart and they had the same brand spray and she couldn't stand it. Same brand but different reactions which leads me to believe that the one I bought online was watered down or something.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Hook

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Bitter Apple is a great product! However, the item I received was diluted with alcohol and did not work! I had used Bitter Apple in the past and I was very surprised when my dog continued to chew sores on her skin. So I tasted a small bit on my finger. All I could taste was alcohol. I have reported this seller to Amazon. Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Delozier

customer_reviews.title: Saved my marriage
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this spray for a few years now. It is the only thing that keeps our 3 spoiled rotten cats out of the wifes plants. I should add the cats are mine and the plants are hers. This product may have saved our marriage. One of the cats just love a lazy afternoon of plant munching but with this miracle product I no longer have to sleep on the couch because my cat has destroyed her plants. Thr spray does lose its magic after 6 months in the cabinet. You will see some pics of the cats and the plants tell me the cat dont look spoiled to you!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca B.

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes, I dont need to spray!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff for my teething Lhasa Apso pup. He likes to chew on couch strings, toes, hands, gates, molding and doorways. I first give the command of "no bite" and give him something he is supposed to bite on. If he is dead set on chewing, I spray this. Sometimes, all I need to do is take out the bottle, he will sniff it and I wont have any issues from him for a while. You may need to spray certain areas daily but that's to be expected since its a spray.
customer_reviews.author: Shahneese WilliamsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad it worked for some people, but it didn't work for me. My dog still chewed on her leash, even with repeated coatings. Does this stuff even contain anything bitter? It just smells like a bottle of rubbing alcohol. Worse yet, the bottle leaks like crazy. You're supposed to shake it well before spraying. That's fine, but then it leaks everywhere. I returned my original order, thinking it was just a bad bottle. Nope. Replacement had the same issue. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: My bulldog likes to lick and chew on his paws. He will do it all of the time and the sound drives me nuts. He also chews wood furniture and pillows too. Not anymore....muaw hahaha...He hasn't eaten any furniture or pillows since I started spraying them with this stuff. He doesn't lick/chew his paws either. Seems to last about a week or until he gets a bath and then he starts up on his paws again. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: WHEN THE CAT'S AWAY, MY FLOWERS STAY
customer_reviews.text: My cat, for some strange reason, has always been attracted to and loves to chew on anything plastic. That includes the stems of artificial floral arrangements. For years, I could not put my Sunflower Pitcher with a gorgeous faux flower arrangement on my table because of this. So, recently I saw this Grannick's Bitter Apple and decided to give it a try. IT WORKED! She does not go near the flowers anymore. I spray them a bit every couple of weeks, just to make sure she's always repelled should she decide to try again. I wish I'd seen this product sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Mike'sSister

customer_reviews.title: I've been using this for years for every pup, ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for years for every pup, and I have to say that it just doesn't work. I just bought it again as you forget over time and soaked my pup's brand new leash in this bitter apple liquid. He chewed it through and through in three places within an hours time. He's not a big chewer. Somehow, it made the leash far more appealing, I believe
customer_reviews.author: Into the wild

customer_reviews.title: Smelled like rubbing alcohol only
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the original and the replacement. It smelled like pure rubbing alcohol. I've used this product in the past a long time ago and it didn't smell anything like it should. I was not about to spray this on stuff my cats use because I didn't want them licking the rubbing alcohol off.
customer_reviews.author: M. Willcox

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: So this product is mostly alcohol with very little bitter apple. I didn't realize that when I bought it. I even tasted it myself and it just tastes like rubbing alcohol and when you spray it, it just smells like a sanitized doctors office. I wouldn't recommend this product at all. It also says on the bottle that its not safe to ingest which is exactly what your dog is going to do when they lick whatever furniture you sprayed it on. It makes zero sense to sell a product that is not indigestible there for not safe when its something your fur baby is going to do. In my opinion this product is a law suit waiting to happen.
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: Great for terriers' sensitive noses!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for my Airedale Terrier. Worked like a charm for a 3 mon - 6 mon pup! I was warned Airedales will destroy furniture, walls , even take down a house! Heehee Immediately worked on all surfaces- fabric, wood, furniture, walls( yes she did try to eat a wall) and on hands for trainer to deter biting. In three months of teething no damage to home, belongings, or master's hands, shoes or clothes! You must be diligent in watching puppy & spraying tempting articles . And you must offer pup alternative things to chew- kong toys, balls, nylabones etc
customer_reviews.author: Laura Petrie

customer_reviews.title: Works for us
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1 year old pup who loves to chew on everything (including furniture!). Decided to try this out, and my pup stop chewing our crap (Thank God!!). You just spray a little on whatever your dog is chewing and that's it. It has an alcohol odor that lingers for about a minute or 2. The reason I knocked down a star is because you do have to keep on spraying hot spots every so often because it does fade away and my dog will be chewing once again. But overall, this product works for us :)
customer_reviews.author: Veronica G.

customer_reviews.title: Works at first, but eventually our dog licked it
customer_reviews.text: Our dog had a hot spot on his belly that wouldn't heal because he kept licking it. We tried a plastic cone, but our little acrobat figured out how to defeat it. So we sprayed him with this product. You should've seen his face the first time he licked it. Bitter beer face! We sprayed him 4X/day with this, and it seemed to keep him from licking, at first. But after a few days, he started to acquire a taste for it, and it no longer seemed to have any effect. Fortunately a few days of Benadryl under vet's orders helped clear up his hot spot.
customer_reviews.author: Timm Martin

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works....sometimes
customer_reviews.text: I have 2x dogs that are very aggressive chewers. I was pretty desperate to find something that works to curb the chewing. This worked AMAZINGLY well for one of my dogs. He absolutely hates the taste and will not touch anything that I sprayed with this. Unfortunately this did not work at all for my second dog. She will just happily chew anything that I sprayed with this and it is almost like it encourages her chewing. So bottom line...4/5 since it does work exactly as described for one of my dogs. It seems like it just depends on the dog if this product will work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Really Work
customer_reviews.text: I've seen videos on YouTube where people use this spray to deter their pet ferrets from chewing or biting ... but it doesn't work for my girls. Or only sortof.. they stop biting the item (because it tastes bad), but they instead start clawing at the item and destroy it anyway. They end up rubbing the product off the object and then go back to chewing. As other reviews have mentioned, this product smells very strongly of rubbing alcohol and not much else. The nozzle also leaks like crazy, and drips everywhere when I try to spray it. Very disappointed with the performance of this product.
customer_reviews.author: KellyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Bitter-ish
customer_reviews.text: I use it mainly for doggy first-aid. My dog tore his pad and after I cleaned and dressed the wound, I sprayed this all over the bandage tape as a way to deter him from pulling it off (as he always does) and kept an eye on him. Within the hour, as soon as i started doing dishes and turned my back, he pulled off the bandages with his mouth. I sprayed it on my hand and tasted it just to see how bitter it was, and I've gotta say it's probably only as bitter as a grapefruit. It might work better for other dogs, but mine is determined apparently. probably wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: mheathe3

customer_reviews.title: It works!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a dachshund whom I love with all my heart but no matter what we did he wouldn't stop chewing furniture, shoes, dirty clothes, ANYTHING! I saw this spray pop up in a suggested box and liked the reviews. I tried it because at this price, why not? My kids think it's hilarious that the dog gets all excited to come in the house and chew the couch then tastes it and turns away immediately. We now spray all shoes we buy and all furniture. You have to respray some things like if your kids go out camping and the shoes no longer taste like the bitter apple to the dog, etc. It's safe on furniture and odorless!!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Works okay, wish there were something better
customer_reviews.text: I've used Grannick's Bitter Apple for over 30 years. Somehow it doesn't seem to deter as much as it used to. That said, it does deter unless the item is too tempting or it's been a few days. This is the best product I've found. In fact, the other product I tried (which was bitter apple and tea tree oil) actually encouraged my dogs to chew things up. (I've got a review over on that product fail.) So sorry I tried that. Now I'm respraying everything with Grannick's today unless I find something better using my power of Google. So I'll stick with Grannick's until I find something better.
customer_reviews.author: 📚 Bookwyrm 📚Top Contributor: Brewing

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I tried it with my dog, and very little success. I know nothing works for all dogs but I was hoping this would work. Only seemed to work when I drenched my pant legs or hands in this stuff, once dried it did nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.text: I can't say this is a bad product, because it's not. It's more of a 3 star product because it's middle of the road in reliability. Worked wonders on my German Shepherd puppy. She can't stand the stuff and works perfectly for her. For my Black Lab puppy, this thing is candy. Not only does it not stop chewing behavior but it actually incites it. He loves the stuff. Does it work? For some dogs it's amazing. For others it'll make bad behavior worse. Good product, just keep in mind when buying it that it's definitely not a guarantee.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Placker

customer_reviews.title: I think it's watered down
customer_reviews.text: I bought an 8 oz. bottle previously from another seller & it worked great. I bought 2 16 oz bottles ALOT cheaper & it's not any good. The bottles were leaking & what was left in them doesn't work. I don't think it was the same product. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The spray smells a lot like alcohol to me
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars because while it does deter my dog from some things in the house (wall moldings, seat legs, sofa legs, wood) it doesn't stop her from chewing shoes and the spray leaked whenever I pressed down. I'm guessing the shoes have a more pungent odor and my dog absolutely loves ripping them up to get to the inner sole. May or may not work for you depending on what you're trying to get your dog to stop chewing! The spray smells a lot like alcohol to me.
customer_reviews.author: Shiberu

customer_reviews.title: Should've ordered this a long time ago!
customer_reviews.text: I had gone back and forth on purchasing this product for so long. I have a kitten who has loved chewing up phone cords and house plants. I didn't think this stuff would work but out of final desperation (I don't want my kitten to get sick and she became uncontrollable) I bought this stuff. I sprayed it on my house plants and she doesn't go near them any more!!! I can't attest to the phone cords as she grew out of that habit but definitely working with the house plants and I am so happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well, I try to apply it when the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well, I try to apply it when the dog is not around to see me do it, seems to be more effective that way. Its effectiveness does seem to fade over time so you need to use it more as a teaching tool and make the dog learn to think that the object they are chewing/biting is ALWAYS bitter (this is why you don't want them to see you apply it). Minus one star just because if you open the bottle you will see that the liquid is brownish yellow so it WILL discolor white objects like walls and carpets if reapplied too frequently.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Completely, totally worthless. Actually attracts dog! And, like other reviewers, sprayer leaks everywhere.
customer_reviews.text: Those items on which I've sprayed this product actually attract my dog, leaving him licking and licking as if it was delicious. That, and the spray bottle is awful; every pump features a spray, as well as product leaking out from the nozzle, down the bottle and dripping everywhere. 180-degree opposite of advertised (and supposedly intended) use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Safe and Effective
customer_reviews.text: Grannicks Bitter Apple Spray is a safe and very effective chew deterrent for dogs. I spray this wherever my dogs are having issues with chewing or licking and they absolutely hate it. They’ll quickly learn to avoid the area. It’s been safe on any and all furniture or fabric pieces I’ve sprayed. My dogs have quickly learned to recognize the bottle.. I don’t even have to spray the product if they see me get the bottle. They immediately know they’re not supposed to be doing whatever it is that they’re up to.
customer_reviews.author: Kalee

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: Worked for my pup. We had an issue with her chewing her leash, but after spraying it with this she will leave it alone for the most part. Sometimes she still grabs it trying to play, but lets it go much easier now. I agree with others that it smells strongly of rubbing alcohol when first applied, but the odor fades as it dries. The spray bottle is also pretty flimsy, so I purchased a trigger style spray bottle and dumped the spray in there.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: If your dog licks and chews this may help
customer_reviews.text: Vet used this bitter apple to keep my Golden from licking after surgery. I use it to discourage paw licking with moderate success. Have also used it on the little lava rocks around gas logs (DO NOT spray while there is open flame) that seemed to attract my Golden and my daughter's miniature schnauzer. It is invisible so spraying on furniture other other things your pooch is chewing should be okay, but test first. It doesn't last very long, especially on his paws and he recognizes the bottle and takes off as soon as I grab it. Bitter apple won't cure itchy skin or fix a shredded pillow, but it is a tool in discouraging and perhaps ending learned behavior.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Super sweet and easy to train
customer_reviews.text: The Bitter Apple worked wonders for me. After about a month, I had no problems with chewing on any furniture, shoes, socks, etc. I would spray the solution on anything I caught her chewing on other then her toys and at the same time introduce a toy to her. She got the message. I have never left her in the crate when I left home and she has never destroyed anything in the house. I have had her since she was 9 weeks and now she is three years old. Super sweet and easy to train.
customer_reviews.author: Synthia Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: My pup absolutely hates the taste and avoids anything that's been sprayed more than once (required since the scent and taste will eventually fade away). Things she used to chew on she now actively avoids. The key is spraying the object right in front of them and then spraying your finger and making them taste it.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: My Welsh corgi puppy just ignores the spray. He likes to pull on threads, cloth and carpets. He tire up the bottom of a curtain and pulled some stitching from a carpet. I repaired the curtain and cut the hanging threads from the rug. Sprayed both thoroughly. All done for a few hours when it gets too quiet, you know what I mean. I pop into the living room, no room of curtain is a mess again and he is rolling around on the carpet in the spot I sprayed. My vote is no.
customer_reviews.author: Taco

customer_reviews.title: Life SAVER
customer_reviews.text: This is a game changer with a Puppy! Get it if you have a chewer. My Munchkin chews everything! My wooden gates, to me, tags, clothes, pee pads etc etc. This stops him in his tracks!! He does Not like it. He will stop chewing whatever it is. I use it on cords, the gates or anything else i do not want him to chew. When I put a new pee pad on a tray i spray the edges with this and now he no longer chews them. This is a life saver! He was driving Bonkers! If you are thinking about getting it, Just do it.
customer_reviews.author: The PeanutTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: I guess it's a good product, hard to really tell though
customer_reviews.text: It's alright i suppose, doesn't seem to work on some surfaces as well as others. My puppy likes to chew on electrical cords and tags and the spray doesn't seem to stick on these surfaces, but when i used it on the corners of my fabric couch and pillows he doesn't seem to go back to these items.Otherwise, I guess it's a good product, hard to really tell though. Also the smell is more of a rubbing alcohol smell rather than apple like i expected.
customer_reviews.author: PandaPanda

customer_reviews.title: Useless for My Mutt
customer_reviews.text: I might as well have sprayed beef flavor on the furniture. My 47lb mutt ate right through the sprayed furniture cover and made a hole in the sofa - and that was after she destroyed the sprayed stationary bicycle pedal. This may work for some dogs, but not mine.
customer_reviews.author: K9Mom

customer_reviews.title: I don't think this is the magic fix....
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it works or not... The smell is pretty heavy of rubbing alcohol. And, if it works, it has to be re-sprayed pretty frequently. I'll spray something, the puppies will ignore it for a big while the alcohol smell is present, and then they're in the area 10 minutes later. The primary area we used it was on a rug that they had deemed their new bathroom. It didn't really help. We also put it on baseboards that they chewed once. They didn't chew them again, but I don't really think it's because of the spray.
customer_reviews.author: InkfingersTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Mixed results
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to attempt to keep several cats from eating our indoor plants. Of the two culprits, one was horrified at the taste and the other one seemed to think it was a secret sauce to improve the nuance of chlorophyll. Go figure. He also frequently gets his head stuck in obviously small places (the handle of the fruit basket, the window panels when they're open, and socks) so maybe he isn't the best animal to base my observances on. It gets four stars for deterring the cat with some sense from grazing while we're all in bed.
customer_reviews.author: Head Mistress

customer_reviews.title: Saved our base boards
customer_reviews.text: Our dog kept chewing on the baseboards through the house no matter how many chew toys she had. After we sprayed it everywhere except one room to test it, and behold she stopped everywhere else except that room. We did notice that we needed to spray it on about every week to keep her off of it, but after about a month or a month and a half she stopped even trying. We kept going it for a couple months after for good measure to make sure the habit was broken.
customer_reviews.author: A Monkeys Uncle

customer_reviews.title: Works barely
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as I was getting tired of my puppy chewing on my feet. Spray it on and she does seem to be turned off a little, depends on how determined she is at the time, unfortunately, this only works for a little while maybe 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: Our golden retriever has a hot spot on his leg that he will not leave alone. He has had medication, bandages, covers, and the cone of shame. Nothing worked. So we thought we would give this a shot. Not only did this not help but he licked his entire leg happily. I tried spraying the leg again and he just started simply licking the bottle. He loves the taste.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Updated: Maybe it works??....Does not work!!!
customer_reviews.text: Updated: After using a few times on furniture legs, the pups do seem to stop chewing. Upgrading the review to 3 stars as it still needs reapplying often and is not a miracle product. It does seem to gently deter chewing. If they aren't intent on destroying something, they will move on to the next thing after spraying. Sprayed 5 mins ago & pup is licking it off the chair. Not only does it not work, but I am now concerned that she is ingesting rubbing alcohol which is a primary ingredient. It smells like pure rubbing alcohol wen sprayed (assuming to speed drying).
customer_reviews.author: Staci

customer_reviews.title: My cat hat
customer_reviews.text: My cat, Dunder, has a bad habit of playing with cords, string lights, and our house plants. We sprayed this on various items he insists on chewing, and it was most effective on our plants. On our majesty palm, he tried to eat a frond and instantly began licking and biting the air. He didn't like the taste, and after a couple more tastes gave up completely. It's not generally a problem anymore, and the spray has not harmed any succulents, palms, cacti, bonsai, or herbs in our house. This bottle is a great size and will seemingly last a lifetime. The only thing I don't like is the rubbing alcohol smell but that evaporates quickly with good ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: sophsters

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: For some reason my dog thinks certain types of pillows and blankets are food. He has never chewed up anything else but seems to keep coming back to these particular types. I douse everything in the bitter spray and he doesn't even show any interest in chewing it! I only have to reapply the spray after I wash the pillow case or blanket. I make sure I douse both the pillowcase and the pillow itself as well. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: JennnTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Worked for pit/hound/??? in a cast
customer_reviews.text: She wouldn't chew the cast just after I sprayed it. She would get back at it after a few hours, so reapplication was necessary. It did seem to cause some amount of drooling, which wasn't helping the cast situation, but the priority is keeping her from eating the thing and it did that well enough. Main take away for me is it will work for some dogs, but it won't last forever. I just sprayed the cast every time she came in from outside and that seemed about right.
customer_reviews.author: Celina Wilt

customer_reviews.title: Great price. Works great on my dog.
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my dog. I did need to reapply few times on the same places she wanted to chew on but after few times she stopped. I even sprayed it on parts of our lawn where she tried to chew the grass, no bad reaction to any of the things I sprayed it on: pillows, furniture fabric and wood, bamboo, plastic literally everything. I know some dogs dint care for the taste and will chew your stuff anyway, you’ll need to try something else such as: peppermint/Eucalyptus oil diluted with water.
customer_reviews.author: Michael & Na’ama Devivo

customer_reviews.title: Stops Chewing Fast
customer_reviews.text: As a puppy our dog (like most) had a habit of gnawing on people's hands as well as items that weren't his toys. We made a point to put the bitter apple spray on our hands (if we were playing with him) as well as furniture legs the first few weeks we had our puppy. He HATED the taste of it and stopped chewing almost immediately. We never had issues with him chewing anything after using the spray. He's 1.5 now and hasn't been crated since he was potty trained and we haven't lost a single pair of shoes, furniture, or any other items to his chewing. Get this spray and use it early on!
customer_reviews.author: Lily S.R.

customer_reviews.title: first spray intensely bitter, following sprays possibly watered down?
customer_reviews.text: I think this product was watered down. The first pump there was already liquid in the tube. It sprayed on me and my dog so I tasted it. It was incredibly bitter. Very intense and exactly what I was expecting, after 1 link my dog shook his head went for water. Now I'm on my 5th or 6th application, my dog has started licking again, and it sprayed on my hand so I tasted it again and I can barely taste anything at all. I think there was originally product in the tube and watered down product in the bottle. Very disappointed. I plan on going to petsmart and purchasing another bottle because it worked well in the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: L.Smith

customer_reviews.title: didnt work for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: wasn't the right thing to keep newly adopted dog to quit play-biting my hands and arms. I never know when he will decide to jump in my lap to play so I can have it on me and be prepared. will take consistent training instead. I timed it right once or twice and he did notice it on me, but super-bitter taste didn't faze him. different blogs for different dogs. may work great for forbidden objects they think they want to haul off with. like shoes. hmmm think I will try that right now. one certain shoe out of 100's (yes, am female lol) he goes for. go figure.
customer_reviews.author: bonanaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It works! But be patient, it took me about one week
customer_reviews.text: Worked! As others mentioned, I had to reapply several times. Maybe 2 times a day for a week. Our teething pup hated the bitterness (it’s bad! I tried it). He moved on to other furniture I hadn’t sprayed so I sprayed those as well and he was done chewing on furniture by the next week. I still have 2/3 of the bottle left!
customer_reviews.author: TRT

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog has been chewing on the wooden bench in our backyard, so I was looking for something to deter her from destroying it. I chose Grannick's Bitter Apple for Dogs Spray because it had decent reviews and was reasonably priced. As others have mentioned, this spray might not work for your dog. Mine was not deterred at all, and she is still chewing away to this day. Now I have a massive bottle of spray that is useless. I would recommend getting a smaller, more potent bottle of spray that will deter your dog once and for all.
customer_reviews.author: LindseyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Wish I'd bought this before I brought my puppy home. Turns out he LOVES wood and ate my baseboards :-( and stairwell. I originally ran out and bought this at a local pet store, but it's so much cheaper here so I bought my 2nd bottle here. I've heard people say it doesn't work, but it most definitely worked for us. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Like Magic!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 4 month old standard poodle who is constantly trying to teeth on me. I just put some of this stuff on my socks and pants legs and I am now totally free of puppy chomps. He sniffs my feet a few times and then goes back to chewing on one of his actual chew toys. It worked instantly, the socks and pants are fine, and i can't even smell it. Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: Rain

customer_reviews.title: product works, bottle stinks.
customer_reviews.text: sprayed my hands as often as I sprayed my target, so I recommend they improve the bottle. transferring contents to my own spray bottle, which is counterproductive & a pain in the tail - but the product itself is def a deterrent to the dog, so the stuff works. just sprayed my hands with bitter apple & she stayed away from my hands even after I washed my mitts with a great soap. ugh! lol.
customer_reviews.author: Not Karen

customer_reviews.title: Kind of works
customer_reviews.text: When you first spray it on it seems to help but it doesn't take long to wear off so you have to do it again. ALso the sprayer is kind of leaky so it gets on your hands. On teh otehr hand, we haven't found a better product.
customer_reviews.author: DanFfx

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly for us!
customer_reviews.text: Have used this product since the day we brought our puppy home at 2.5 months old. She’s 10.5 months now. When she was teething she took to chewing on baseboards, drywall, and the corner of the carpet. We applied the product as soon as the damaged spots were discovered and it got her to give up this habit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works For Us
customer_reviews.text: I don't think this is a surefire chewing countermeasure. But, we have a puppy that has to try out everything to chew on, including furniture, power cords, or whatever. This turns him off of whatever we spray it on. Granted, he is not a really persistent chewer. He will usually leave things alone when asked but, being a puppy, soon forgets. I think a more hard-headed dog might not be discouraged by this product. But, it is so easy and cheap, it is definitely worth giving it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Lab pup hates it
customer_reviews.text: Lab pups will eat anything. All I have to do is pick it up and she stops chewing. She is 5 months old now and getting somewhat aggressive with her play fighting with the 5 year old Australian Shepherd dog. I spray this on the older dogs hair and the game id off. Great stuff.
customer_reviews.author: San Antonio Pete

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: This product certainly works to keep our puppy from chewing on what she should not. But, the sprayer leaves alot to be desired. It provides a very fine mist but leaks like crazy around the pump. Both bottles are the same in this regard. My solution was to transfer to another sprayer bottle that I had. Works great now.
customer_reviews.author: Keoke

customer_reviews.title: Didn't do what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work to get my dog to stop chewing the pads of his feet. I sprayed 3 times per day for a week and by the end of the week he decided that he liked the way the bitterness tasted, or at least didn't mind, and would chew his pads even while the spray was still wet. The spray bottle arrived properly and the spray seems to be bitter and taste bad - that is all correct and earns 2 stars. My dog is just a nutter and likes it.
customer_reviews.author: John Sheesley

customer_reviews.title: stubborn kitty leaves plants alone
customer_reviews.text: I have tried squirting Loki with the water bottle and scolding when I was able to actually catch him in the act of chewing plants but this stopped him in about a week. He doesn't even go near the plants anymore. I try not to have nay plants that are known to be toxic to dogs and cats in my home but I just feel better knowing he isn't eating them anymore and eats the fresh cat grass by the water bowl instead.
customer_reviews.author: Cynister

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Puppy hates it
customer_reviews.text: We use this for our corgi puppy and he hates it. We spray it on anything and everything: shoes, feet, arms, table legs, blinds, cords, etc. He's not the worst chewer I've dealt with, but he loves chewing on new things. Once we spray, he avoids it entirely. We've only had him a couple weeks so not sure how long it'll last and when we need to respray, but so far it's still working.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bransley

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to the cone
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great for us. My pup had swollen and slightly raw areas around her paws due to an allergy. She continued to chew them making it worse. We attempted the "cone of shame" for a while but didn't like how much it limited her. This was a great alternative. I did have to apply 2x/day but it didn't seem to irritate her sores and she left her feet alone. This is a big bottle too so we we have a lot left even after using it daily for a week
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth L Roberts

customer_reviews.title: and the face she made left no doubt that this stuff must taste real bad!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog occasionally licks granulomas when she's anxious or, as I recently discovered, needs more exercise. This works to keep her away from her legs. Sometimes I wrap her leg so the wound can heal and then spray this on the medical tape. She doesn't try to pull it off. Once I caught her sneaking a little lick of this after I sprayed it, and the face she made left no doubt that this stuff must taste real bad!!! Only four ingredients and made in USA, too. :)
customer_reviews.author: A. LaConte

customer_reviews.title: Goofy
customer_reviews.text: Bottle leaks when you spray it. Leaks around the nozzle and gets on your hands. Just make sure you wash your hands before you touch stuff your going to put in your mouth, you'll figure it out real quick when you taste something funny. I actually think my dog likes the stuff. I used it to stop her from licking her leg. Dogs do this as they age out of boredom. Idk. I think it's a 50/50 shot. You won't know til you try it on your pet. Mine is just goofy.
customer_reviews.author: Working Class Family

customer_reviews.title: It might work...
customer_reviews.text: It may or may not work depending on your dog. Not all dogs are alike so that is why I gave it a middle of the road rating. It did NOT deter my puppy from biting and chewing. This is the third brand with yet again different ingredients that I have tried and nothing seems to phase him. Luckily I bought this from Amazon because it was way cheaper than any other place I looked at for buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: My Lizzie Lou had surgery & wasn't healing very well. I took her to three different vets & the first two suggested another surgery. The 3rd vet suggested this spray. She has left her wound alone & has healed up nicely. I wish I would have known about this stuff sooner. Also, I couldn't find this product at the local Wal-Mart so, I conveniently purchased it on here. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lori B

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It worksI received a large new area rug and a new coffee table. I have 26-month-old puppies that have chewed the wood legs on my chairs. So I covered my coffee table legs by spraying this everywhere on the legs, and I sprayed the edge of the 8 x 10 rug all the way around, the Rug is 100% wool rug is 100% wool by the way and did no damage to it Thought that was pretty awesome since it’s new. Whether or not I just got lucky and the dogs decided not to touch any of these two items I don’t know. But the odds are they didn’t like the bitter apple spray
customer_reviews.author: catherine H.

customer_reviews.title: No more eating stuff he shouldn't!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great - a spray or two is all you need to deter your dog from eating/chewing things he shouldn't. If your dog is stubborn and very determined, I suggest spraying the spray in his mouth the first time so he develops a strong deterrent to the taste. I read that in a puppy training book - although it seems mean it makes the spray much more effective.
customer_reviews.author: bbombassei

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product -- works just as described and doesn't break the bank!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff immediately turns my dog away from chewing on items! Works on anything from end tables to shoes to couch cushions to garbage bags full of trash -- just give a couple squirts and your dog will instantly turn it's nose away from the item. I just bought my 2nd bottle and have recommended this to my friends who have issues w/ their puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Osgood

customer_reviews.title: STOPS SCRATCHING & LICKING
customer_reviews.text: I've tried everything to stop the itching--gnawing--licking on my dogs--one or two of these little pills will stop it all. I'm on my 2nd bottle of these--so I've given my 3 dogs 1,000 with no side effects I've seen.I think it is a lot like banamine an it works--The price is low too $9.08 for 1,000 pills--This stuff works!! So nice not to hear the licking or scratching all the time.
customer_reviews.author: MOON

customer_reviews.title: Solution for mouthy puppy
customer_reviews.text: We love our Goldendoodle puppy...and he loves...almost everything on his level. Especially our new(ish) rugs. This spray keeps the rugs safe from the puppy and it worth much more than the cost of the bottle of spray for that reason alone! It also works on the couch (seems puppy gave up on the rugs when they didn't taste so great and headed for the couch). Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Carolinahat

customer_reviews.title: MEH
customer_reviews.text: Bought this spray to keep my collie puppy from chewing on the edge of carpeted stairs. I was able to apply enough of it that worked for me there! She hasn't been back to it. I then tried it on a patch of wall board that she had scraped up with her teeth. It wasn't as effective there as most of it ran down the wall. I'm guessing on some surfaces, the gratification of chewing it is worth the bitter aftertaste! It is a moderate repellent at best.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Serious allergic reaction to it
customer_reviews.text: While our dog remained unfazed by the scent and continued to bite and gnaw our furniture, my wife had a severe allergic reaction to it requiring steroid treatment to address. After spraying on our outdoor furniture, she sat on it to play with our dog and in 40 minutes she developed a rash that persisted for 2 days before we decided to go to the doctor. Beware of what this product might cause!
customer_reviews.author: Juan Banda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for aggressive chewer’s
customer_reviews.text: I have a newly adopted one year-old Staffordshire terrier who is a very aggressive chewer this stuff works you have to repeat it off and now we’re just saturate your walls or anything that you don’t want this dog detach and it works also water gun training works
customer_reviews.author: dawn kampf

customer_reviews.title: Mostly ineffective
customer_reviews.text: We tried spraying this on the bars of the dog crate to keep our dog from trying to chew her way out of the metal crate, but she was undeterred. I have not tried spraying it on her paws to keep her from licking the whole time we're gone, because I'm worried it would sting where she has started to irritate her skin.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Good product if you value your wood finishes
customer_reviews.text: I have a 9 week old Labrador puppy, who seemingly would love nothing better than to chew the corners of all of my cabinetry. I have sprayed this liberally around any corners/areas where the pup seemed interested. I am happy to report that now just the smell of it turns her away. It should be noted that you have to apply this every few days as it seems to lose it's effectiveness. The packaging indicates that it can stain surfaces but so far, I have not found that to be the case.
customer_reviews.author: D. Marie

customer_reviews.title: Hotspots Begone
customer_reviews.text: Bought to help keep our lab puppy from chewing everything in creation. Unfortunately, did not stop her from any of that destructive behavior. However, it worked beautifuloly on hotspots. When she's going to town chewing herself, we spray her with it. It immediatly cools the spot, and she calms down and stops the chewing. Great for relieving hotspots.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Higham

customer_reviews.title: Puppyy problems
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to spray on the moulding in my house. My puppy was chewing on the corners and it needed to stop immediately. I first tried lemon juice, but that didn't do the trick so I ordered this. He hasn't been back to chew there since. I was a little worried that it could potentially affect the color of the white paint, but it hasn't done that either. Life saver!
customer_reviews.author: Dominique

customer_reviews.title: Overcoming Bitter Apple!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 7 month old rescued greyhound/pit mix "chewer' who destroys everything with her needle sharp puppy teeth. Was hoping Bitter Apple would prevent destruction but she seems to enjoy it as much as the furniture she's devouring. It has worked in past with our other rescues but this one is beyond redemption...we do love her more than the Queen Ann chair though!
customer_reviews.author: Deer Whisperer

customer_reviews.title: It's working
customer_reviews.text: This is our second bottle and second week using it. You have to reapply constantly. We are seeing an improvement. We say NO BITE he stops and sits. We praise, give a treat or distract with a toy. He sees the bottle, backs off our toes and Jumps up to grab our shorts. LOL! We're talking about a nine week old, 5 pound shih poo.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Miracle Product
customer_reviews.text: Our golden is 10 weeks old and LOVES to chew on furntiture (and our hands and toes) whenever he gets a chance. I’ve sprayed a homemade Applecider vinegar mixture that helped but made the entire apartment smell like vinegar. We received this product today and already love it! He would rather chew is big bed that we bought rather than lay on it; however, he wouldn’t even bite it once he smelled the spray. Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Worthless bottle of mystery liquid
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much just seemed like alcohol or something along those lines. I tasted it...just burned on the tongue. It didn’t keep my new, little puppy from chewing anything. Thankfully the chewing state didn’t last forever!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Quinley

customer_reviews.title: Product definitely discourages biting, bottle not great.
customer_reviews.text: I tried what another reviewer said about giving a spritz directly into the mouth when correcting biting and it worked very well. I tried it myself and it takes kinda like when you get bug spray in your mouth, probably from the Isopropanol which makes it evaporate quickly. She doesn't seem bothered by it too much, but stops biting. The sprayer on the bottle was defective and leaks pretty badly if it press down all the way. I also suggest putting it in a smaller sprayer if you have one. The 16oz is pretty bulky to carry around for training.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Stallion

customer_reviews.title: Smells like alcohol, which is the second ingredient after water
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to work. I then decided to use it literally on a shoe right when i saw my dog start eating it. I thought that would work... The dog got the shoe later and destroyed it more than it has ever destroyed a shoe. This might work for less rebellious dogs. Smells like alcohol, which is the second ingredient after water. I wonder if ethanol would work just as well for half the cost...
customer_reviews.author: Serenity Skies

customer_reviews.title: So heres the thing with this product...
customer_reviews.text: So heres the thing with this product. It actually works in the sense that when our dog tastes it, he HATES it. He shakes his head and stops right away. Now the problem is it doesn't seem to stop him from trying again once it wheres off. Im not certain if thats the point or not, but thats what we've experienced with this product so far. That said, I would still give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Lino412

customer_reviews.title: Life saver for me!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works GREAT on my "disturbed" dog, who would climb on me and lick the life out of me. Nothing works to calm her down, but as soon as I grab the bottle to spray my hands and legs, miraculously she stops & I'm able to hook the leash. And boy, it is bitter, as I tried it myself to see what it tastes like. However, the bitterness goes away rather fast and washes out easily, so no lingering bad taste if cooking or playing with kids.
customer_reviews.author: misty

customer_reviews.title: Terrible results for me
customer_reviews.text: I sprayed this on items that my dog had already chewed (ie: furniture arms) and all it did was draw her back for more since it was now flavored. We were able to stop the behavior after we stopped using this product.
customer_reviews.author: myrrick

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to stop my puppy from biting. Tried it on rugs and wood. It did not do a thing. Puppy continued being destructive. He would actually bite the exact area I had just sprayed! Did not work at all for me. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa P

customer_reviews.title: I honestly can't recommend this enough
customer_reviews.text: This stuff helped break my first corgi puppy of chewing on the things I didn't want her to. Her trainer sprayed it once directly in her mouth, and after that anything I sprayed it with she wouldn't go near. I've been using it for my second young corgi rescue for the past couple of weeks and it's saved the wooden gates we use. I honestly can't recommend this enough.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This has saved quite a few things in my house! I spray it on anything that the dogs mistakenly think is for them to chew on. I even had to spray it on the side of a cat scratching toy. The cats still used it. I only had to spray it twice and the dogs haven’t touched it since.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer BlumTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great deal as add on item!  Works to deter puppy!
customer_reviews.text: This does deter my very destructive puppy from chewing on things (we should have named her Gozer the Destructor), but I do have to retreat certain very attractive to puppy areas (like baseboard corners and the stems of my tomato plants) daily. Even though used frequently on certain baseboard corners, I see no damage caused by the spray.
customer_reviews.author: Cari

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for our dogs
customer_reviews.text: This product smells a bit like alcohol and did not deter my puppies. My puppy was curious and almost seemed more interested in the item sprayed. It is recommended that you try a smaller size first. Product arrived on time, as described and in new condition. Three star rating only because it did not work for our dogs.
customer_reviews.author: B4Me

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff. My pup won't touch where I spray. It doesn't leave a bad scent in the air or residue on things I spray. It is really bitter too, I licked it myself. Get out your camera for a picture of your dogs face when you put a dab on it's tongue. It's priceless!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Costal Living

customer_reviews.title: He doesn't enjoy the smell/ taste but it's not unpleasant enough to ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog didn't really care for it but I can't say it was a success. He doesn't enjoy the smell/ taste but it's not unpleasant enough to keep him from biting 100% of the time. . He has learned to associate the bottle with unwanted behavior to a degree and sometimes spraying near him (NOT ON HIM) gets him to get his act together .. temporarily. My dog is super determined and stubborn so for a more civilized dog this may be the answer . Gave a3 star because it did get him to stop chewing on my sofa legs.
customer_reviews.author: AnaIriz

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING PRODUCT!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This works AMAZING!!!!!! I was getting so frustrated with my puppy chewing on everything and biting me. He ripped up my carpet, chewed up my wood furniture, and chewed through the dry wall. He also tugs on my pants to play. I sprayed this and the chewing stopped! I feel so much less stressed now. If you are considering this product, DON'T WAIT! It works so well!
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: works for me as long as the solution remains wet on the object.
customer_reviews.text: I suppose that each person who buys this product will have a different opinion because all dogs are different with different reactions. My 4 month old puppy does not like the taste of this spray, however the smell does not bother her, if I squirted something and the solution dried. The only way she backs off is if the solution is still wet on the object, she won't touch it then. I have so, so results using it, it does help some, depending on the situation, as long as the object remains wet. I am sure other dogs will have all different reactions to the product.
customer_reviews.author: Frank S

customer_reviews.title: Works well...maybe too well
customer_reviews.text: Used the spray to discourage our puppy from chewing on shoes and parts of our leather couch. It only took one bite/lick for him to yelp and run away. He seems to be scared to even walk over by the couch now...so we are being a bit more careful with what we spray. We don't want him to be scared of everything in the house.
customer_reviews.author: nSx4

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING!!! My puppy would shred her pee pads if I was gone longer than she found acceptable. I would come home to a horrible mess after work!! She did this for about 4 days before I finally had a chance to go to my local PetSmart and get a bottle to try. It worked on its first use!!! I just sprayed it all on the pee pads and voila!!! No more shredding. She still pees and poos on the pads, just no more shredding. Thank goodness.
customer_reviews.author: taratkd

customer_reviews.title: Don’t look any further! Get this to prevent biting!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this hoping that she wouldn’t like it. Success! Stopped our pup from using my kids as a chew toy! Even sprayed the bottom of the door to prevent her from scratching and window sills. Best purchase for our new pup BY FAR! If you have a new fur baby at home I would HIGHLY recommend this! Since I’m already the alpha she knows not to bite me but it’s more difficult to defend my own kids. Would give this 10 out of 10!
customer_reviews.author: sonia

customer_reviews.title: Works on our cats
customer_reviews.text: We have a cat who loves to chew expensive OEM cables. I sprayed it on a destroyed cable and let it dry. It stopped him cold after one taste. He's still giving me those sad kitty eyes after a week, but my husband is happier. I put on gloves and used a pad saturated with the stuff to wipe down the intact working cables and cords. Mission accomplished.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
